text: Identification of cis - acting elements required for the LPS-responsiveness of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

( A ) Schematic representation of the -539 / +92 region of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter with the location of candidate cis - acting regulatory elements indicated with boxes .
The location of the 5 ' ends of the -539 , -189 and -87 reporter constructs is also shown .
Positions of murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter - specific primers , 338 / -315 and -5 / +19 used in ChIP assays are indicated .

( B ) RAW 264.7 macrophages were transiently transfected with the indicated murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 promoter-luciferase reporter <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> constructs and either left untreated or treated with 100 ng / ml LPS for 16 hrs .
The results show relative <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity following LPS treatment and represent the mean and SEM of 4-7 independent experiments .
